channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Security Cabinet Meets to Vote on Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu urged the security cabinet to approve the agreement after a day of delays. His office said the deal could go into ef...

item.title: Netanyahu Faces a Political Crisis Over the Gaza Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: With his far-right coalition partners opposing an end to the war and threatening to quit, the Israeli prime minister may have to choose: them or the a...

item.title: Can Communities Survive the Fires?
item.description: A writer from Los Angeles surveys the loss.

item.title: After 15 Months of War, Gazans Dream of Returning Home
item.description: They daydreamed about the people they would hug as soon as the truce took hold, the graves they would visit and the homes they would rebuild.

item.title: Nine out of 10 Gen Z and millennials say ‘workplace cheating’ is acceptable—that’s napping on the job or sneaking off early
item.description: More than half of Gen Z and millennial employees admitted to taking a quiet vacation in the past year.

item.title: What We Know About the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Agreement
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called a meeting of Israel’s security cabinet on Friday to discuss the deal.

item.title: After 15 Months of War, Gazans Dream of Returning Home
item.description: They daydreamed about the people they would hug as soon as the truce took hold, the graves they would visit and the homes they would rebuild.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly blaming former Meta exec Sheryl Sandberg for a company inclusivity initiative
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg is overhauling Meta's DEI initiatives — and reportedly blaming his former COO, Sheryl Sandberg, for an old policy.

item.title: Fire at huge California lithium battery storage plant forces 1,500 people to evacuate
item.description: The Moss Landing Power Plant, located about 77 miles south of San Francisco, is owned by Vistra Energy and contains tens of thousands of lithium batte...

item.title: Iran’s Leader in Moscow to Sign Cooperation Treaty With Russia
item.description: The agreement will stop short of a military alliance, but it is expected to formalize an increasingly close relationship between Moscow and Tehran.

item.title: Trump’s interior secretary pick Doug Burgum says U.S. needs to make more electricity from coal to win AI arms race
item.description: If confirmed, Burgum would become the chief steward of federal lands.

item.title: Facing a Flurry of U.S. Sanctions, China Prepares to Hit Back
item.description: With days until Donald Trump is sworn in, China is bracing for a trade war, aiming at industries as diverse as semiconductors, apparel and industrial ...

item.title: Cease-Fire Expected to Move Forward, and a Last-Ditch Pitch to Save TikTok
TikTok Makes Last-Minute Push as Supreme Court Is Poised to Rule on Ban
item.description: With the court signaling it will release a decision on Friday, lobbyists for the app pushed lawmakers to shift course.

item.title: EU considers enlisting Belgian king and 81-year-old decree to block Hungary’s potential veto of Russian sanctions
item.description: The EU is reportedly considering using a wartime, signed by the king, to block the potential transfer of €190 billion worth of Russian assets.
